page.title: 06PRIVATE BUILDING
page.content: {Blenheim Orchard,}at the north edge of the village, is comprised of{bungalows and{semi-detached houses,}built on an orchard of Church Farm. To the south is the{Lambert Estate of bungalows, built on land originally part of Pool Farm. On both estates building started in{1957.}Ribbon type development has occurred along Leckhampton Lane to the north-east at intervals since 1935. A group of local workers from the nearby Dowty factory formed a {co-operative}between 1955 and 1960 to {build their own bungalows.}They pooled resources and skills and built the bungalows in their free time. The many recent conversions and extensions to existing properties indicate satisfaction with the amenities of the area and a reluctance to move out of the village.
